Name: Pattern Recognition - IND
Text: We are given an initial DECLARE model for a loan application review process. The model is specified as a Python dictionary with particular keys corresponding to different DECLARE constraints.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Identify potential bias: The model currently does not have any constraints that account for sensitive attributes. For example, the model allows a FinalDecision (which could be Approve or Reject) to occur after a StartApplication and RequestAdditionalInfo without a fair check.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Add new constraints to mitigate bias: Non-succession constraint to prevent direct succession from CheckApplicantRace to FinalDecision. Response: after CheckApplicantRace, require BiasMitigationCheck. Coexistence or response for ManualReview.

Name: Backtracking - PE
Text: Note that the initial model does not have CheckApplicantRace, ManualReview, BiasMitigationCheck. Consider adding to existence or not. Decide not to add to existence because we dont require them in every trace, only when race is checked.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Response constraint A -> B means if A occurs, then B must occur anywhere later, enforcing order. Nonchainsuccession prevents adjacent A then B. These together force BiasMitigationCheck and ManualReview between CheckApplicantRace and FinalDecision.

Name: Ethical or Moral Reasoning - PE
Text: Ensure that decision steps cannot immediately follow sensitive attribute events without BiasMitigationCheck and ManualReview to enforce fairness and consistency in loan application process.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Rationale: Response CheckApplicantRace -> BiasMitigationCheck ensures bias check after race check. BiasMitigationCheck -> ManualReview adds review. ManualReview -> FinalDecision completes process. Nonchainsuccession prevents direct jump.
